Description: Rim and bowl sherd of Attic red-figured pottery cup, probably type B; interior glazed black; top of rim reserved; exterior: red-figure decoration consisting of upper part of youth to right, looking down and probably leaning on a stick; dark brown dots on lighter brown ground for hair, light brown below ear for incipient beard; left arm extended from elbow (dilute brown inner marking), and drapery over left shoulder; relief contour used; two letters of painted inscription.
Producer name: Compare with: The Oinophile Painter (Beazley in ARV)
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 513, no. C84)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0655) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain Fasc. 3, Oxford Fasc. 1 (p. 13, pl. XIV, no. 18)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
